name: Duminy Vendome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Duminy Vendome for 5 days and had a great stay. We expected the rooms to be small, which they were, but the beds were very comfortable and the sheets & towels were changed every day. The rooms were air conditioned and had all tea & coffee making faclities, trouser press, hairdryer, mini bar etc. The staff were really friendly and helpful in recommending eating places etc. Included in the price was an American buffet breakfast which, although the same every day, there was plenty to choose from. This made a good start to the day as eating out wasn't particularly cheap. Our favourite eating place was recommended by a taxi driver and if you like seafood then pay a visit to Brasserie Bofinger on 5-7 Rue de la Bastille.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Duminy Vendome is redeemed by its fantastic location and spacious rooms. Everything else is very average. Our “non-smoking” room still had ashtrays, the safe was broken and the bedspread was in desperate need of replacement. These little niggles can be forgiven, but the lack of sound-proofing will irritate light-sleepers. The Duminy Vendome is a very, very average hotel in an excellent location.
reviews.title: Average Hotel Great Location
Great location, clean and comfortable!
reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel! We had heard stories of how small all the hotels in Paris are, but we had a king-sized bed and plenty of room. We did upgrade one room class, so this probably helped out with the size, while adding very little to the cost. The main benefit of this hotel is the fantastic location - it is a few blocks from the Louvre and right across the street from the Jardins des Tuileries. We were able to walk to several areas - the Latin Quater, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, to name a few. We also had breakfast included with our room rate, which saved us quite a bit of money. The staff is friendly and speaks English. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an economical and convenient hotel.

reviews.title: Enjoyed staying at Duminy Vendome!
reviews.text: My husband and I got married last summer (Aug. '05) and decided to go to Europe for our honeymoon. We spent the first four days of our trip in Paris. After our travel agent recommended this hotel, we booked it ourselves online. I have to say that the price we paid is very reasonable for a hotel in Paris!

After catching a shared ride from the airport to the hotel, I wasn't sure what to expect since my husband had arranged everything. My first impression was that it was a very cute boutique type hotel. It was small but the staff was friendly. We didnt know any French, but that didn't matter. We had no problems checking in. Once we got to our rooms, yes they weren't your typical American size hotel room, but it was big enough for two people and clean! The rooms were also equipped with air condition, a big tub/shower, lots of towels, coffee maker, etc. We didnt mind the size of the room because we didnt spend much time there. The hotel is in such a great location, that we spent all 4 days, exploring the city by foot! There is just so much to do and its all within walking distance from the hotel!
reviews.title: Nice funky little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date: March 2007
reviews.title: Perfect combination - price & location!

likes.liked: — Low price; Great location (Sorry, that's two things!)
likes.disliked: — The view (Our room overlooked a central courtyard)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewer: David from Orpington, Kent
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very central (a stone's throw from the Louvre) and yet very reasonably priced? Must be something wrong with it ... NO, in fact it was a little gem! The room was small (as we expected) but clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and spoke English a darn sight better than I spoke French.
reviews.title: No Need to stay anywhere else!

likes.disliked: — The garbage truck outside on the street.

reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel!
reviews.text: Perfectly placed for a walking tour of central Paris. Also close to TWO Metro stations if you want to go further afield ... or are simply lazy! (Drivers beware - Trying to park anywhere in the vicinity is virtually impossible.)
We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on the food.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great Value!

reviews.text: OK the rooms are a little small..but you are in a great location..on a quiet street..a block from the subway and the Tuileries.
reviews.title: Stay next a $1200 a night hotel for 1/5 of the price!!!!

reviews.text: The Maurice is next door and the Ritz is two blocks away. If its good enough for them..it is GREAT for you!!!
reviews.title: not so great value

reviews.text: I booked on advance so I got a great price. Check different search engines and try to find one with Breakfast included...there really isnt anywhere cheap for breakfast near by.
reviews.title: Would never stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Duminy Vendome Hotel in april 2007, for 4 nights. I found that it was expensive enough (150 euros/night for a single room) for what it had to offer, though it was above average. Its location is a plus, given its vicinity to the Tuileries metro station and the Louvre Museum.
reviews.title: quaint lovely hotel

reviews.text: That being said, the rooms are quite small but well decorated, very clean with the basic equipment one would expect from a 3 star hotel (mini bar, TV etc). A problem was the noise from the closing doors of the other rooms. The second day I complained about the noise to the receptionist and after a 10 minute speech of mine, finally he moved me to another room which was much better.
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked this hotel through go-today which gave us an affordable package for air and hotel from Washington. The hotel was nice and staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean when we arrived and kept tidy by the housekeeping staff, who were also very friendly. Our room faced into the courtyard, and was quiet at night. Not alot of activity on the street-side of the hotel at night, so I don't think anyone had a problem with noise. Breakfast was good enough to get us going - croissants, coffee, toast, yogurt; plenty to keep us fed until lunchtime. Location was perfect - the Tuilleries metro is a block away, so getting to all points was not a problem. The Louvre, Seine, and Ile-de-Cite are an easy walk. Overall, not the most luxurious hotel, but good enough and a great value for the price and location. We never plan on living in the hotel room on any vacation we take anyway!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Duminy Vendome in early March. The hotel is in an excellent location as far as safety and sightseeing. We found the front desk to be extremely helpful, (in spite of a full house during Paris Fashion Week) even offering wake-up calls and calling for a taxi for our departure. The breakfast downstairs was much better than your average european breakfast at this class of hotel. The rooms had more than adequate space and a large bathroom. Our room even had an LCD flat panel tv. I have been to many cities in Europe and I found this hotel to be above average for its class. It is a great value and I would highly recommend it to any of my friends.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice and Location...

likes.liked: — I have been to Paris many times and have never found the rudeness from the French that people talk about. I believe that if you are kind and respectful that you will receive the same in return, but that's life in general right?

reviews.text: Booked and paid for the room months in advance. When I arrived in Paris to check in, they had my booking but did not have a room for me. They sent me blocks away to an inferior hotel.
reviews.title: No Room at the Inn

likes.disliked: — The fact they could not accommodate a prepaid reservation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on September 8th in the early morning and stayed until the 17th of September. We were greeted by a lovely young lady who secured our luggage for us and informed us the room would be ready by about noon. We searched the hotel brochures and took off to explore Paris! The location on Rue Mont du Thabor is very handy. It was a short walk to Rue de Rivoli and Les Jardins des Tuileries where you can take a bus or metro. It's also a short walk to book a L'Open Tour which we did for the first 2 days of our stay which gave us a very nice overview of what we wanted to see. It's also a short walk to either the Louvre or Musee D'Orsay from here. Paris is a very "walkable city". The public transportation is wonderful. We took the RER to Versailles for a mere 5 Euros roundtrip and it was only a half hour each way! We enjoyed many of the wonderful brasseries and, especially, Angelina's Patisserie on Rue de Rivoli...not to be missed!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Duminy Vendome for 6 nights the last week of September 2006 for a postponed honeymoon. Arrived early Sunday morning in Paris and went straight to the hotel. The front desk clerk had a room ready for me and upgraded me to the Privilege room for free. Pretty nice of her! This is a more expensive room and is really big for European standards and was facing the courtyard; very quiet. Of course, all older hotels in Europe have thin walls, so you can sort of hear the next door neighbor's plumbing sometimes or if they talk really loud, but otherwise, I highly recommend getting an inner courtyard room if you want quiet. The rooms are updated and have the regular amenities; air conditioning, coffee pot, steam press, hair dryer, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent location and good service

description: Hotel is located in the centre of Paris just steps from the Tuileries Garden, the Louvre...The rooms at Hotel Duminy-Vendome are equipped with a telephone, satellite TV and private bathroom, air conditionning.Duminy-Vendome serves a buffet breakfast each morning in the vaulted breakfast room. Bar opens every day from 7:00 am to 2:00 am.Duminy-Vendome is 200 metres from Tuileries Metro (line 1) and 600 metres from Pyramides Metro (lines 7 and 14). The Louvre Museum and Champs Elysees are within walking distance.
